intro: Eriospermum, commonly known as the woolly burr or desert cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are characterized by their hairy, often glandular surfaces, which give them a distinctive appearance. They are typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, where they have adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions. Eriospermum species produce small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. The plants are often used in ecological restoration projects due to their ability to thrive in disturbed soils and their role in stabilizing sandy environments.
